unnormalised: Entertainment: Bollywood's Box Office Brims with Biryani & Blockbusters!
normalised: Entertainment: Bollywood's Box Office Brims with Biryani and Blockbusters!

unnormalised: Bollywood's releasing films faster than you can say "Chai, anyone?"! This week alone, 3 movies hit the silver screen, vying for your hard-earned Rs. 200.
normalised: Bollywood's releasing films faster than you can say "Chai, anyone?"! This week alone, three movies hit the silver screen, vying for your hard-earned rupee two hundred.

unnormalised: "Prem Ki Paathshala", a rom-com set in IIT Delhi, hopes to capture the hearts of Gen Z, provided they can tear themselves away from their reels. Apparently, love blossoms even amidst coding chaos.
normalised: "Prem Ki Paathshala", a rom-com set in I I T Delhi, hopes to capture the hearts of G-e-n Z, provided they can tear themselves away from their reels. Apparently, love blossoms even amidst coding chaos.

unnormalised: Then there's "Action Jackson Returns…Again!", starring the ever-youthful Arjun Kapoor. Sources say the explosions are so loud they can be heard all the way in Bandra! Hopefully, it's better than the last "return".
normalised: Then there's "Action Jackson Returns…Again!", starring the ever-youthful Arjun Kapoor. Sources say the explosions are so loud they can be heard all the way in Bandra! Hopefully, it's better than the last "return".

unnormalised: Finally, a dark horse: "Onam Tales", a Malayalam remake celebrating the spirit of the festival. Think vibrant colours, boat races, and enough sadhya to feed the whole of Kerala! Will it compete with all the loud movies?
normalised: Finally, a dark horse: "Onam Tales", a Malayalam remake celebrating the spirit of the festival. Think vibrant colours, boat races, and enough sadhya to feed the whole of Kerala! Will it compete with all the loud movies?

unnormalised: Early predictions put "Prem Ki Paathshala" in the lead, but honestly, anything could happen. Bollywood is more unpredictable than the Mumbai monsoon! Critics are divided, so grab some samosas, pick your poison, and may the best film win!
normalised: Early predictions put "Prem Ki Paathshala" in the lead, but honestly, anything could happen. Bollywood is more unpredictable than the Mumbai monsoon! Critics are divided, so grab some samosas, pick your poison, and may the best film win!
